hi and welcome to the brief a recap of
the best cloud stories for government
education nonprofits and health care I'm
Sarah Worley from AWS as we power tech
here are your top stories from the AWS
public sector blog from February 2020 we
start in outer space
millions of satellites take photos of
the Earth's surface every day a decade
ago this might have seemed like science
fiction but now earth observation data
is available and being used by customers
in cool ways tech startup Greenspan
combines data a eye and spatial web
applications to make agricultural
systems transparent and sustainable for
farmers blue dot observatory uses open
source data to keep an eye on our
planets water resources discover more
stories like these and find out how you
can get started today with Earth
Observation data in our blog post
speaking of open data what could you do
with 2.8 million image and research
files for one of the world's most famous
museum and research institutions the
Smithsonian Open Access Initiative has
released high-res media and research
files to the public for learning
discovery and creative use this is the
largest museum collection publicly
released to date and it's open to anyone
to check out at any time read our blog
post on the Smithsonian open access
initiative for more information
and while we're on the subject of
research the IDC named AWS a leader in
Internet of Things for smart cities in
their recent IDC market scape vendor
assessment report the IDC found AWS to
offer the broadest set of solutions and
products for worldwide IOT application
platforms for smart cities to learn more
about AWS for digital government check
out stories from Kansas City Chicago
Louisville and other past winners of the
AWS city on a cloud innovation challenge
next the cloud can save cost compared to
on-premises solutions but according to
the 2019 state of the cloud report
survey cloud spending is still a
challenge for 76% of respondents in our
full blog post we give you some common
pitfalls of cloud spend and link you to
cost management tools to help you
navigate cost optimization can reduce
your cloud spend by identifying
mismanage resources reserving capacity
for discounted rates and right sizing
services to scale if you've made the
move to the cloud you don't want to miss
this post and finally from transforming
physical space on campuses to adjusting
for fluctuating student enrollment learn
about the hottest trends for desktop as
a service in education educational
institutions are turning to desktop as
the service solutions which provide
consistent readily available access to
applications on virtual desktops these
services help schools reduce costs and
work towards their mission to deliver
quality education check out our blog
write-up for a deeper breakdown of
desktop by the service trends and ways
you can start implementing them today
look for links above or below this video
